author: @infobae
title: Carreteras cortadas en Valencia, Castilla La Mancha y Andalucía por inundaciones. - Infobae
text:
Madrid, 1 nov (EFE).- Gran número de carreteras han sido cortadas en varias comunidades autónomas, siendo las vías más afectadas por las inundaciones las de la Comunidad Valenciana, seguidas de las de Andalucía y Castilla-La Mancha, por ello la Dirección General de Tráfico llama a los ciudadanos a reducir los desplazamientos durante este puente de Todos los Santos.
En estos momentos, Emergencias de la Generalitat aconseja evitar hacer viajes por carretera desde cualquier punto de España hacia Valencia, y ha recordado que las vías que se están abriendo son de uso preferencial de los efectivos de emergencias.
Según la DGT, varios tramos de la A-3, la A-7, la V-30 y la V-31, estas dos últimas de accesos a Valencia capital, siguen cortados por las inundaciones, al igual que otras carreteras de la red secundaria.
En Andalucía este viernes, los efectos de la borrasca se concentrado en la provincia de Cádiz, especialmente en los municipios de San Fernando y Chiclana por acumulación de balsas de agua en carreteras.
Además, continúan cerradas 23 carreteras por inundación de la calzada, 14 en la provincia de Cádiz, cuatro en Sevilla, tres en Granada y dos en Málaga.
En la provincia de Sevilla las cuatro carreteras cortadas son la SE-3105 entre Carmona y Guadajoz, la SE-3201 entre El Viso del Alcor y Carmona, la SE-4108 en Carmona entre los kilómetros 3 a 4 y la SE-5206 entre La Gironda y El Coronil.
En Granada las tres carreteras cerradas al tráfico en ambos sentidos son: la A-4200 entre Río de Baza y Benamaurel, la GR-4104 entre El Bejarín y Benalúa, y la GR-9109 en Cúllar en el kilómetro 0,1; y en Málaga permanecen cortadas por inundaciones la A-357 en el kilómetro 43,2 y la A-7954 en el enlace de Rivera.
Además, la circulación de trenes de Media Distancia entre Sevilla y Málaga continúa cortada por “acumulación de agua”, y se desconoce cuando se restablecerá.
 En Castilla-la Mancha, la provincia de Cuenca ha sido la que más ha resultado afectada por la dana, y la carretera CM-2122 sigue cerrada en el kilómetro 14,3, según ha informado el Gobierno de esta Comunidad.
También en Tarragona continúan cerradas la N-340, que está cortada entre Amposta y la Ràpita en sentido norte y se hacen desvíos por la TV-3408, y sigue cerrada la C-12 hacia Tortosa en los dos sentidos.
 Adif y Renfe informan de que los desplazamientos en tren entre l'Aldea-Amposta y Tortosa han sido interrumpidos por acumulaciones de agua a la altura de Camp-Redondo, la incidencia solo afecta la R16, y el alta velocidad continúa cortada.
La DGT aconseja que cuando se produzcan causas meteorológicas extremas, se debe proceder detenerse fuera de la carretera siempre que sea posible. EFE

author: @kytv
title: With temps dropping across the Ozarks many choosing not to utilize warming centers
text: With temps dropping across the Ozarks many choosing not to utilize warming centers SPRINGFIELD, Mo. (KY3) - Many people who could utilize homeless shelters choose to brave the elements independently. They have their reasons, but one thing remains the same: it’s dangerous in the cold. “It came down to a point where I actually had to drink to stay warm,” said Travis Seek, a homeless man living at the Victory Mission. Travis Seek has been in and out of poverty for decades. In August of 2022, he found himself homeless in Springfield. Despite his issues, he wouldn’t go to a shelter. “I would never would go into homeless shelters or anything of that nature,” said Seek. “Always was couch surfing and partying.” In December of 2022, that all changed. Cold weather came for the Ozarks with a vengeance, with wind-chills nearing -40 degrees. Seek says he saw many friends lose fingers and toes to the cold. “Frozen toes, frozen feet, frozen ear lobes,” said Seek. “Yeah, black just turned black. I’ve seen your lobes turn black. Lips turn black, blue, and black. Toes are missing. I have a friend who actually got four of his toes missing from the cold weather. (He’s) trying to stay in an abandoned house, trying to stay warm.” He says that stuck with him. So when he exited jail in December 2022, the cab they called brought him to Victory Mission. He’s been there ever since. He says pride was the main reason he didn’t want to utilize shelters or warming centers. “Pride and ego,” said Seek. “I always thought I was better than most people that come to a homeless shelter. I wasn’t able, you know, they got rules. And you know, kind of lived in a rebellious lifestyle where I didn’t accept rules. So I can you can’t drink here, you can’t do drugs. You can’t. You can’t bring women. Everything’s separated. You got rules to follow.” It’s an issue that many face. Mindy McDonald with Victory Mission says it’s a multi-faceted issue. Some don’t want to give up independence, and some don’t want to share living space. The main issues, though, are safety and drug use. I think the drug and alcohol policy is a huge element,” said McDonald. “And honestly, it really helps with the safety factor. But that can be a barrier for somebody who, you know, substance use and mental health often it’s a lot more nuanced than just being sober not being sober.” [CLICK HERE ](https://www.ky3.com/2023/12/18/see-list-cold-weather-shelters-ozarks/)for a list of cold weather shelters in Springfield and across Missouri. To report a correction or typo, please email [digitalnews@ky3.com](mailto:digitalnews@ky3.com) Copyright 2023 KY3. All rights reserved.

author: Poster
title: Discover the Vibrant World of Mexico and Central America-Inspired High-End Jackets, Pullover Jackets
text:
From the vibrant markets of Oaxaca to the fashion scene of Los Angeles, Mexico and Central America-inspired high-end jackets, pullover jackets, and ponchos by RCSLA have captivated style enthusiasts with their exquisite craftsmanship and colorful designs. These pieces seamlessly blend traditional artistry with modern luxury, creating garments that are both chic and culturally significant. This article delves into how these unique styles reflect the rich heritage of indigenous cultures and influence global fashion trends.
The Rich Heritage of High-End Jackets and Ponchos
Mexico and Central America-inspired
Pullover jackets for men and ponchos are celebrated for their bold colors and intricate stitching, showcasing the rich cultural legacies of the region. Drawing from the artistic traditions of the Mayans, Aztecs, and other indigenous cultures, these garments often feature vibrant motifs and patterns that hold deep cultural meaning. Handmade in Los Angeles by RCSLA, each piece utilizes high-quality materials such as lightweight cotton and luxurious wool, transforming them into wearable works of art. Founder and designer Moustapha Ndiaye, an avid traveler and xenophile, carefully selects one-of-a-kind fabrics that reflect unique stories and craftsmanship from their origins. The popularity of these pieces in global fashion highlights a growing appreciation for garments that tell stories and celebrate rich cultural histories.
Cultural Representation in Fashion
As the fashion industry embraces a more global perspective, the demand for authentic, culturally inspired attire has surged. High-end jackets and ponchos inspired by the artistry of Mexico and Central America play a vital role in this trend, offering wearers not just a fashion statement but also a connection to rich traditions and identities. These garments symbolize the intersection of traditional craftsmanship and contemporary fashion, serving as a means for cultural expression and preservation in an ever-evolving world. Renowned local artists like Frida Kahlo, whose work celebrates Mexican identity and artistry, have paved the way for this rich dialogue between culture and fashion.
Pullover Jackets: A Testament to Versatility
Expanding beyond traditional designs,
Pullover jackets for men exemplify functionality and ease of wear. Valued for their comfort and casual style, pullover jackets are favorites among those who appreciate practicality without sacrificing aesthetics. Perfect for both cool evenings and relaxed outings, these jackets offer warmth and versatility, making them staples in modern wardrobes.
**Ponchos: Embracing Tradition and Comfort**
The poncho, a timeless garment with deep roots in indigenous cultures, further enhances the diversity of RCSLA’s offerings. Known for their flowing silhouette and comfort, ponchos can be dressed up or down, making them ideal for various occasions. Whether layered over a casual outfit or styled as a statement piece, ponchos reflect the artistry of traditional textiles while providing effortless style.
Trends and Innovations in Outerwear
Similar to their high-end counterparts, both pullover jackets and ponchos have evolved through innovations that blend traditional elements with contemporary materials and cuts. Designers are now incorporating eco-friendly fabrics, adjustable features, and weather-resistant coatings, enhancing these garments’ style and practicality. This evolution underscores the adaptability and lasting appeal of these pieces within the fashion industry.
High-end jackets, pullover jackets, and ponchos inspired by Mexico and Central America, crafted by RCSLA, hold a unique position in the fashion world, combining artistry, comfort, and cultural significance. They exemplify how traditional designs can transition into modern fashion essentials, appealing to diverse audiences while honoring rich cultural narratives. For those looking to explore these exceptional styles further,
http://www.rcsla.com) offers an exclusive selection that captures the essence of vibrant artistry and practical elegance. Whether you are drawn to the rich textures and colors of high-end jackets, the versatility of pullover jackets, or the flowing charm of ponchos, this platform showcases the best of both worlds.

Aircraft assembly workers walked off the job early Friday at Boeing factories near Seattle and elsewhere after union members voted overwhelmingly to go on strike and reject a tentative contract that would have increased wages by 25% over four years. News

author: @Dailyhuntapp
title: Preity Zinta Celebrates 8 Years Of Marriage With Gene Goodenough: You Are My Love For All Seasons
text:
Preity Zinta and Gene Goodenough are celebrating eight years of being married to one another. To commemorate the occasion, Preity shared a series of pictures featuring the two, over the years. Accompanying the post was a heartfelt caption, detailing Gene's importance in her life.
Preity Zinta celebrates her wedding anniversary with Gene Goodenough
For the unversed, Preity Zinta and Gene Goodenough tied the knot on Leap Day February 29, back in 2016. Celebrating the date, which comes once every four years, Preity Zinta took to her Instagram handle to share pictures of herself with her husband. The adjoining caption saw her shower love on him for being her better half, a stellar partner and an even more commendable father. One of the hashtags used in the post also read 'pati parmeshwar'.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Preity G Zinta (@realpz)
\n The caption to the post read, "Happy Anniversary to my better half What can I say about you. You are my love for all reasons & for all seasons. Thank you for being the best husband & father & for holding fort when I am away I love you to the moon & back #Happyanniversary #leapyearlove #patiparmeshwar #ting"
How did Preity Zinta and Gene Goodenough meet?
Preity Zinta and Gene Goodenough's meet cute happened in the lush city of Los Angeles. Preity had been a regular visitor to LA, in lieu of meeting her nephew and niece who live there. Preity made a complete move to Los Angeles post their 2016 wedding.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Preity G Zinta (@realpz)
\n Gene and Preity are now raising their twins, Jai and Gia in LA itself. The couple welcomed the twins back in 2021 via surrogacy. She has evidently kept her children in touch with her culture and her own work. In a past interview to ANI, she said, "The title track, Koi Mil Gaya is something I play when my kids don't go to sleep, it helps calm them down."
